alert.note: Alert for Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 11 at 6:32PM CDT until October 11 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN ROCK ISLAND...SOUTHWESTERN WHITESIDE...NORTHEASTERN SCOTT AND SOUTHEASTERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 632 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Princeton, or 10 miles northeast of Bettendorf, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Camanche, Garden Plain, Albany, Princeton, Cordova, McCausland, Rock Creek Marina and Campground, Newton Corners, Folletts, Rock Creek Park, and Princeton Wildlife Area. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in the Quad Cities. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
